messages.content: What does the noise_latent_perlinpinpin node allow for in ComfyUI?
The noise_latent_perlinpinpin node allows creating latent spaces filled with perlin-based noise that can be used by the samplers.
What is the limitation when upscaling with the noise_latent_perlinpinpin node?
You should keep the exact same aspect ratios if you want to upscale or the patterns will not match.
How has the noise_latent_perlinpinpin algorithm been simplified?
The algorithm has been simplified to support all resolutions and make it easier to use, with no artifacts.
What is the purpose of the magic line of code in the noise_latent_perlinpinpin description?
The magic line of code, 'noise = torch.remainder(torch.abs(noise)*1000000,11)/11', destroys the smooth pattern while keeping it predictable at all scales.
What do I need to have installed to use the noise_latent_perlinpinpin node?
You need to have BlenderNeko noise related nodes and the workflow, which can be found at https://github.com/BlenderNeko/ComfyUI_Noise, to use the noise_latent_perlinpinpin node.
What is recommended for better upscales when using this node?
Using the city96 latent upscaler, available at https://github.com/city96/SD-Latent-Upscaler, for upscaling is highly recommended.
What does the workflow included in this image represent?

The workflow included in the image represents the basics of using perlin-based noise with ComfyUI, including noisy perlin injection, SDXL Base, VAE decode, lanczos resize, VAE encode, and SDXL refiner.
